doc.previous: Four centuries ago Gerolamo Cardano proposed a similar formula see below which still appears in many textbooks  In these formulae and denote any choice for the square or cube roots Changing of choice for the square root amounts to exchanging and Changing of choice for the cube root amounts to circularly permuting the roots Thus the freeness of choosing a determination of the square or cube roots corresponds exactly to the freeness for numbering the roots of the equation
